channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Two years after derailment, toxic chemicals still roll through East Palestine
item.description: Two years after derailment, toxic chemicals still roll through East Palestine.
item.content:encoded:
Two years after derailment, toxic chemicals still roll through East Palestine.

(Image credit: Daranee Balachandar)
item.dc:creator: Cat Murphy

item.title: Global stocks slide as Trump imposes tariffs on imports
item.description: Stock markets around the fell as President Trump imposed tariffs on key trading partners, Canada, Mexico and China
item.content:encoded:
Stock markets around the fell as President Trump imposed tariffs on key trading partners, Canada, Mexico and China

(Image credit: Kazuhiro Nogi)
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: How younger generations keep the folk art of lion dancing alive in LA
item.description: At the East Wind Foundation, in the heart of Los Angeles' Chinatown, young people dedicate their after-school hours and weekends to practice the traditional folk art of lion dancing.
item.content:encoded:
At the East Wind Foundation, in the heart of Los Angeles' Chinatown, young people dedicate their after-school hours and weekends to practice the traditional folk art of lion dancing.

(Image credit: Leafy Yun Ye)
item.dc:creator: Leafy Yun Ye

item.title: Vagus nerve stimulation may tame autoimmune diseases
item.description: The next big advance in treating diseases like rheumatoid arthritis could be tiny pulses of electricity delivered to the vagus nerve.
item.content:encoded:
The next big advance in treating diseases like rheumatoid arthritis could be tiny pulses of electricity delivered to the vagus nerve.

(Image credit: SEBASTIAN KAULITZKI/SCIENCE PHOT/Getty Images/Science Photo Libra)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Forgotten for 138 years, a Black composer's magnum opus finds a stage
item.description: Morgiane, perhaps the oldest opera by a Black American, finally receives its full public performance, shedding light on the forgotten heyday of opera in New Orleans.
item.content:encoded:
Morgiane at St. Louis Cathedral in New Orleans on Jan. 24, 2025, along with members of Opera Lafayette, OperaCréole and the Louisiana Philharmonic Orchestra.'/>

Morgiane, perhaps the oldest opera by a Black American, finally receives its full public performance, shedding light on the forgotten heyday of opera in New Orleans.

(Image credit: Camille Farrah Lenain for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Matt Bloom

item.title: Amid intense grief, a college student is comforted by a stranger on a plane
item.description: When Cara Beth Rogers was studying abroad in college, her brother died in an accident. On the plane ride home, a stranger made her overwhelming grief a bit easier to bear.
item.content:encoded:
When Cara Beth Rogers was studying abroad in college, her brother died in an accident. On the plane ride home, a stranger made her overwhelming grief a bit easier to bear.

(Image credit: Cara Beth Rogers)
item.dc:creator: Laura Kwerel

item.title: LA Times owner boosts RFK Jr. online, as writer says paper cut his critique
item.description: Los Angeles Times owner Patrick Soon-Shiong has become a fierce champion online for Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s nomination for U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services.
item.content:encoded:
Los Angeles Times owner Patrick Soon-Shiong has become a fierce champion online for Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s nomination for U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services.

(Image credit: Win McNamee/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: How corporate America got DEI wrong
item.description: President Trump is accelerating the attacks on diversity-in-business programs. But DEI experts say this may be the wakeup call big companies need.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is accelerating the attacks on diversity-in-business programs. But DEI experts say this may be the wakeup call big companies need.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Former Spain soccer official Rubiales goes on trial for unsolicited kiss of player
item.description: The former president of the Spanish soccer federation goes on trial Monday accused of sexual assault for kissing forward Jenni Hermoso after Spain's victory at the Women's World Cup final in 2023.
item.content:encoded:
The former president of the Spanish soccer federation goes on trial Monday accused of sexual assault for kissing forward Jenni Hermoso after Spain's victory at the Women's World Cup final in 2023.

(Image credit: Bernat Armangue)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Before they were 2025 Grammy Award winners, they were Tiny Desk performers
item.description: Many of the major winners who picked up trophies on music's biggest night have graced the Tiny Desk. Watch their performances here.
item.content:encoded: Many of the major winners who picked up trophies on music's biggest night have graced the Tiny Desk. Watch their performances here.
item.dc:creator: C Mandler
